homedescription.description: Just as a thirsty man seeks water, water also searches for a thirsty person. Just as every human being has his life, form and mind to help others, nature needs various forms of help (Wasse) in the law of natural justice.The unwritten law of natural truth is to help other beings and not to be avoided. 'Vaase Foundation' welcomes you with the best sense of service to work to participate in whatever kind of help we can participate in this world, in this life, even when we need innumerable helps.

motive.motive: The 'WASSE TRUST' has come to work for the most economically backward people, people who do not have a way of living with all the people, those who live in isolation for generations, and the people who live beyond the cities in the dense forests and forests and mountains to protect their lives, health and prosperity.We cordially invite those who are interested in this work to join us and serve the people.
motive.motiveDes: Let's start making a positive change today!

namereason.namereason: The First 5 Letter Connection of the Five Elements - WASSE Acting as Objective 5 THE MAIN FUNCTION OF THE WASSE TRUST IS TO SERVE AND SERVE THE PEOPLE ACCORDING TO TIME, PURPOSE, PLACE AND NECESSITY. WATER , AIR , SUN , SKY , EARTH = WASSE Let's work together !

Donateus.Line1: Giving is born with the special social goodwill ,
Donateus.Line2: Contribution to social development to benefit the lives of the poor and needy by freely donating the amount of their choice to the WASSE TRUST Foundation. Our donation of rupees will bring many benefits to the poor and needy. Share the Transaction Recipt of the Transaction to our trust's Contact number. Thank you for sending it.

ProgramStructure.para: WASSE Trust operates its eco-development work across the following seven thematic areas or ‘programmes’. Teams under all programme include roles mentioned in the organisational structure. Each programme works to achieve a mix of several of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals listed below. All programmes are approached in an intersectional manner, with cross-sectoral activities mindfully planned to meet goals, be it through consulting barefoot expertise for building tribal archives within the People and Nature Collectives programme, adopting a gender justice lens within the Climate Change programme, or prioritising disaster responsiveness within the Organisational Development programme.

OrganisationalStructure.Para: WASSE TRUST’s team is over 150 members strong, including our board of trustees and resource persons, who bring valuable insights from tribal communities across the Coimbatore and Central/Eastern India. Our programme working group members map out workflow and streamline task schedules for each project within the seven programmes.
OrganisationalStructure.H1: Each role is assigned various levels of responsibility, according to the following colour key:

CommunityWelbeing.Heading: Community Wellbeing at WASSE TRUST
CommunityWelbeing.p1: The programmes and interventions are designed by viewing “wellbeing” as a concept beyond the set parameters of Human Development Index and through various lenses like livelihood outcomes and political autonomy and its implications on traditional knowledge systems and cultural practices as well as on the mental and physical health of indigenous communities.
CommunityWelbeing.p2: Community wellbeing is achieved only when the economic, social, physical, psychological, political and cultural conditions of every individual in the community are satisfied. The programme components represent these elements of wellbeing and interventions are designed accordingly by prioritising gender inclusivity, climate change and sustainable outcomes.
CommunityWelbeing.p3: Facilitating farm- and forest-based livelihoods for indigenous communities. Pro-environment and gender-inclusive approaches contribute to food, economic security as well as enabling farmer linkages to local enterprise and market opportunities. Designing farm-based livelihood options for landless farmers and creating local economies, short supply chains through bio-input production and centralised, cluster-level nurseries that can raise cash crop saplings.
CommunityWelbeing.p4: Based on the belief that land tenure and property rights are paramount to sustainable livelihoods, wellbeing and pro-conservation outcomes, the programme identifies and nurtures local leadership, develop capacities to govern and make decisions that have long-term socio-economic and political implications for the communities, facilitate Forest Rights Act claims and develop capacities for advocacy by strengthening community voices.
CommunityWelbeing.p5: Ensuring improved health outcomes among communities through preventive health care by promoting better nutritional practices, bridging the gap in accessing timely health care and awareness generation through community health workers. We also identify and train frontline health workers to develop local capacities for sustained efforts on preventive health interventions.

FuturePlan.Heading: Our Future Plans
FuturePlan.P1: To establish 50 educational support centers to prevent school dropout among the school going children of poor.
FuturePlan.P2: To conduct school enrollment campaign at 150 places by setting up awareness cultural team.
FuturePlan.P3: To give self employment skill development and capacity building training to the women SHG members.
FuturePlan.P4: To conduct health camps for the scavenging community and poor people in villages.
FuturePlan.P5: To give medical checkups to all those living in and prevent them from their drinking habits (alcohol consumption) and safe health condition.
FuturePlan.P6: Work with municipal bodies as well as housing colonies commercial complexes hospitals etc to provide safety equipments to sweepers and ensure their social security.
FuturePlan.P7: Educate sweepers to engage in cleaning / sweeping work with use of safety equipments and technology.
FuturePlan.P8: Work in collaboration with corporate sectors, vocational training institute to provide vocational skill training to poor youth.
FuturePlan.P9: To identify school drop out children and supporting for their education development in all villages.
FuturePlan.P10: To organize training for poor people about government welfare schemes.
FuturePlan.P11: To motivating small entrepreneur in villages and town.
FuturePlan.P12: To provide subsidy loans to the SHG members in all villages.
FuturePlan.P13: To conduct training for poor parents in village about their children education and preventing child labour.
FuturePlan.P14: To established women SHG’s and strengthening savings and prevented (Kanthu Vatti) private money lending.
FuturePlan.P15: Work towards social security (Insurance livelihood security, access to credit etc) of the poor people of villages.

activities.activity1: On behalf of the WASSE Foundation, we helped to the Nilampati Adivasi people to cultivate the land by themselves.
activities.activity2: In Coimbatore district Neelampathi Adivasi village, Rangammal's land was provided with irrigation facility for agricultural use from a well that had not been pumped for more than 15 years. Vasi Trust Founder A. Yuvaraja ( Arun ) and Trustee N. Mothi were members of the Trust.
activities.activity3: A meeting with kolukkupatti Hill's adivasi people, for providing guidance to farm their lands.
activities.activity4: An awareness meeting was held in Motiyur Adivasi village, Coimbatore about economic progress and village practices.
activities.activity5: meeting with the Motiyur Adivasi people of Coimbatore district to discuss about their life .
activities.activity6: A village meeting was held with the Motiyur Adivasi people.
activities.activity7: During the research about adhivasi people's living condition at pilinjur villege,Karnataka.
activities.activity8: While the discucss about peoples living conditon at sirumugai villege.
activities.activity9: while the life guidance meeting with adivasi people of keel pillur area which is  located  on pillur villege, Coimbatore.
activities.activity10: In the Adivasi hill village of Kiel Pillur, We provided agricultural support materials to the farmer Vellingiri.
activities.activity11: While the meeting with economically backword SC people of kannappanagar in Coimbatore district with Vasi Trust Founder and Trustees Mr. Jegatheesan and Mr. Nagarajan.
activities.activity12: Trust founder and trustee Viswanathan Nagaraj Jagadeesan visited and inspected the area near the Madurai Veeran Temple in Coimbatore Kamaraj Puram area.
activities.activity13: When we went to provide food items on behalf of our trust as a sponsor for the temple festival at Pillur Dam.
activities.activity14: We presented a motor vehicle license to Mr. Sampath Kumar from the Pannimadai area of Coimbatore.
activities.activity15: On 3.6.2021 at Mettupalayam  municipal cleanup staff and met with employees at the ward office of the ward office.
activities.activity16: National Clean Staff Commissioner M.Venkatesan on 29.09.2021 for Siddhapudur apartments were handed over to the beneficiaries with Municipal Commissioner, Tamil Nadu Cottage Transfer Board Officers opened a kurai theer aalai  on behalf of Vasitrest.
activities.activity17: Provided food on 07.05.2024 for festival to the temple  which is located at pillur dam , coimbatore district.

DonateUs.Heading: Your Donation Makes a Difference in our Nation :
DonateUs.Para1: Your donation goes directly to supporting the cause you care about. Whether it's funding scholarships, providing medi/cal supplies, or planting trees, you'll see the tangible results of your generosity.
DonateUs.Para2: Together, we uplift those in need. Your contribution helps us provide crucial services and opportunities, fostering a brighter future for vulnerable communities.
DonateUs.Para3: We believe in empowering individuals. Your donation allows us to offer skills training, educational resources, or microloans, equipping people with the tools they need to build a better life.
DonateUs.Para4: We are committed to open communication. You'll have access to detailed reports on our website or annual updates showcasing how your donation is used.
DonateUs.Para51: Under Section 80G of the Income Tax Act
DonateUs.Para52: The Indian government offers tax deductions for donations made to registered trusts .
DonateUs.Para6: Your contribution has a ripple effect. It could fund a program that educates future leaders, equip healthcare workers, or safeguard endangered species for generations to come.
DonateUs.Para7: You're not just a donor, you're a partner in progress. By supporting our trust, you actively contribute to building a more just and equitable society.
DonateUs.Para8: No contribution is too small. Together, your collective generosity allows us to achieve our ambitious goals. Every rupee you donate makes a difference!
DonateUs.Para9: Your support empowers us to invest in the future. By focusing on education and healthcare, we're building a healthier, more skilled workforce for a prosperous India.
DonateUs.Para10: Thank you for believing in our work. Your act of giving is incredibly rewarding. You're making a positive impact and creating a better future for all.
